Package jetbrains.exodus.env

Interface Environment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Backupable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContextualEnvironment
    public interface Environment
extends java.io.Closeable, Backupable
    Environment encapsulates one or more stores that contain data. It allows to perform read/modify operations against multiple stores within a single transaction. In short, Environment is a transactional key-value storage.

    Instance of Environment can be created with the help of the Environments utility class: 
         Environment env = Environments.newInstance("/home/me/.myAppData");
    Environment will be created if specified database directory doesn't contain database files. It's impossible to share single database directory amongst different Environment instances. An attempt to do this (from within any process, current or not) will fail.

    To open Environment with custom settings, use EnvironmentConfig class. E.g., opening environment with disabled garbage collector looks as follows: 
         Environment env = Environments.newInstance("/home/me/.myAppData", new EnvironmentConfig().setGcEnabled(false));
    After finishing working with the Environment you should close() it.

        getBackupStrategy

    • Method Detail

      • getCreated

        long getCreated()
        Returns the value of System.currentTimeMillis() when this environment was created. If your application works constantly with a single environment and closes it on exit, the environment's creation time can be used to get the applications' up-time.
        Returns:
        the time when this Environment instance was created.

      • getLocation

        @NotNull
@NotNull java.lang.String getLocation()
        Returns location of database files on storage device. Can be used as unique key for environment instance.
        Returns:
        location of database files

      • openBitmap

        @NotNull
@NotNull Bitmap openBitmap​(@NotNull
                           @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull StoreConfig config,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull Transaction transaction)
        Opens existing or creates new instance of Bitmap. Internally opens existing or creates new store with specific name and config = StoreConfig.WITHOUT_DUPLICATES inside a transaction.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of opened store is formed from specified name and suffix "#bitmap".
        transaction - Transaction used to create store
        Returns:
        Bitmap instance

      • openStore

        @NotNull
@NotNull Store openStore​(@NotNull
                         @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                         @NotNull
                         @NotNull StoreConfig config,
                         @NotNull
                         @NotNull Transaction transaction)
        Opens existing or creates new store with specified name and config inside a transaction. StoreConfig provides meta-information used to create store. If it is known that the store with specified name exists, then StoreConfig.USE_EXISTING can be used.
        Parameters:
        name - name of store
        config - StoreConfig used to create store
        transaction - Transaction used to create store
        Returns:
        Store instance

      • openStore

        @Nullable
@Nullable Store openStore​(@NotNull
                          @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                          @NotNull
                          @NotNull StoreConfig config,
                          @NotNull
                          @NotNull Transaction transaction,
                          boolean creationRequired)
        Opens existing or creates new store with specified name and config inside a transaction. StoreConfig provides meta-information used to create the store. If it is known that the store with specified name exists, then StoreConfig.USE_EXISTING can be used.

        Pass true as creationRequired if creating new store is required or allowed. In that case, the method will do the same as openStore(String, StoreConfig, Transaction). If you pass false the method will return null for non-existing store.
        Parameters:
        name - name of store
        config - StoreConfig used to create store
        transaction - Transaction used to create store
        creationRequired - pass false if you wish to get null for non-existing store rather than create it
        Returns:
        Store instance

      • executeTransactionSafeTask

        void executeTransactionSafeTask​(@NotNull
                                @NotNull java.lang.Runnable task)
        Executes a task after all currently started transactions finish.
        Parameters:
        task - task to execute

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears all the data in the environment. It is safe to clear environment with lots of parallel transactions, though it can't proceed if there is a Transaction (even read-only) started in current thread.
        Throws:
        ExodusException - if there is a Transaction in current thread
        See Also:
        Transaction

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Indicates if environment is working in read-only mode. Use this method instead of EnvironmentConfig.getEnvIsReadonly().
        Returns:
        true if environment is working in read-only mode.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes environment instance. Make sure there are no unfinished transactions, otherwise the method fails with ExodusException. This behaviour can be changed by calling EnvironmentConfig.setEnvCloseForcedly(boolean) with true. After environment is closed another instance of Environment by the same location can be created.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Throws:
        ExodusException - if there are unfinished transactions
        EnvironmentClosedException - if environment is already closed

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Returns:
        false is the instance is closed

        @NotNull
@NotNull java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllStoreNames​(@NotNull
                                                           @NotNull Transaction txn)
        Parameters:
        txn - transaction instance
        Returns:
        the list of names of all stores created in the environment.

                    @NotNull java.lang.String storeName,

                    @NotNull Transaction txn)
        Parameters:
        storeName - name of store
        txn - transaction instance
        Returns:
        true if store with specified name exists

      • truncateStore

        void truncateStore​(@NotNull
                   @NotNull java.lang.String storeName,
                   @NotNull
                   @NotNull Transaction txn)
        Truncates store with specified name. The store becomes empty. All earlier opened Store instances should be invalidated and re-opened.
        Parameters:
        storeName - name of store
        txn - transaction instance

      • removeStore

        void removeStore​(@NotNull
                 @NotNull java.lang.String storeName,
                 @NotNull
                 @NotNull Transaction txn)
        Removes store with specified name. All earlier opened Store instances become unusable.
        Parameters:
        storeName - name of store
        txn - transaction instance

      • gc

        void gc()
        Says environment to quicken background database garbage collector activity. Invocation of this method doesn't have immediate consequences like freeing disk space, deleting particular files, etc.

      • suspendGC

        void suspendGC()
        Suspends database garbage collector activity unless resumeGC() is called. Has no effect if it is already suspended. Environment instance can created with disabled GC.
        See Also:
        EnvironmentConfig.setGcEnabled(boolean)

      • resumeGC

        void resumeGC()
        Resumes earlier suspended database garbage collector activity. Has no effect if it si not suspended.

      • beginTransaction

        @NotNull
@NotNull Transaction beginTransaction()
        Starts new transaction which can be used to read and write data.
        Returns:
        new transaction instance
        See Also:
        Transaction

      • beginTransaction

        @NotNull
@NotNull Transaction beginTransaction​(java.lang.Runnable beginHook)
        Starts new transaction which can be used to read and write data. Specified beginHook is called each time when the transaction holds the new database snapshot. First time it is called during beginTransaction() execution, then during each call to Transaction.flush() or Transaction.revert().
        Parameters:
        beginHook - begin hook
        Returns:
        new transaction instance
        See Also:
        Transaction

      • beginExclusiveTransaction

        @NotNull
@NotNull Transaction beginExclusiveTransaction()
        Starts new exclusive transaction which can be used to read and write data. For given exclusive transaction, it is guaranteed that no other transaction (except read-only ones) can be started on the environment before the given one finishes.
        Returns:
        new transaction instance
        See Also:
        Transaction, Transaction.isExclusive()

      • beginExclusiveTransaction

        @NotNull
@NotNull Transaction beginExclusiveTransaction​(java.lang.Runnable beginHook)
        Starts new exclusive transaction which can be used to read and write data. For given exclusive transaction, it is guaranteed that no other transaction (except read-only ones) can be started on the environment before the given one finishes. Specified beginHook is called each time when the transaction holds the new database snapshot. First time it is called during beginTransaction() execution, then during each call to Transaction.flush() or Transaction.revert().
        Parameters:
        beginHook - begin hook
        Returns:
        new transaction instance
        See Also:
        Transaction

      • beginReadonlyTransaction

        @NotNull
@NotNull Transaction beginReadonlyTransaction()
        Starts new transaction which can be used to only read data.
        Returns:
        new transaction instance
        See Also:
        Transaction, Transaction.isReadonly()

      • beginReadonlyTransaction

        @NotNull
@NotNull Transaction beginReadonlyTransaction​(java.lang.Runnable beginHook)
        Starts new transaction which can be used to only read data. Specified beginHook is called each time when the transaction holds the new database snapshot. First time it is called during beginTransaction() execution, then during each call to Transaction.revert().
        Parameters:
        beginHook - begin hook
        Returns:
        new transaction instance
        See Also:
        Transaction, Transaction.isReadonly()

      • executeInTransaction

        void executeInTransaction​(@NotNull
                          @NotNull TransactionalExecutable executable)
        Executes specified executable in a new transaction. If transaction cannot be flushed after TransactionalExecutable.execute(Transaction) is called, the executable is executed once more until the transaction is finally flushed.
        Parameters:
        executable - transactional executable
        See Also:
        TransactionalExecutable

      • executeInExclusiveTransaction

        void executeInExclusiveTransaction​(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull TransactionalExecutable executable)
        Executes specified executable in a new exclusive transaction. TransactionalExecutable.execute(Transaction) is called once since the transaction is exclusive, and its flush should always succeed.
        Parameters:
        executable - transactional executable
        See Also:
        TransactionalExecutable

      • executeInReadonlyTransaction

        void executeInReadonlyTransaction​(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull TransactionalExecutable executable)
        Executes specified executable in a new read-only transaction. TransactionalExecutable.execute(Transaction) is called once since the transaction is read-only, and it is never flushed.
        Parameters:
        executable - transactional executable
        See Also:
        TransactionalExecutable, Transaction.isReadonly()

      • computeInTransaction

        <T> T computeInTransaction​(@NotNull
                           @NotNull TransactionalComputable<T> computable)
        Computes and returns a value by calling specified computable in a new transaction. If transaction cannot be flushed afterTransactionalComputable.compute(Transaction) is called, the computable is computed once more until the transaction is finally flushed.
        Parameters:
        computable - transactional computable
        See Also:
        TransactionalComputable

      • computeInExclusiveTransaction

        <T> T computeInExclusiveTransaction​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull TransactionalComputable<T> computable)
        Computes and returns a value by calling specified computable in a new exclusive transaction. TransactionalComputable.compute(Transaction) is called once since the transaction is exclusive, and its flush should always succeed.
        Parameters:
        computable - transactional computable
        See Also:
        TransactionalComputable

      • computeInReadonlyTransaction

        <T> T computeInReadonlyTransaction​(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull TransactionalComputable<T> computable)
        Computes and returns a value by calling specified computable in a new read-only transaction. TransactionalComputable.compute(Transaction) is called once since the transaction is read-only, and it is never flushed.
        Parameters:
        computable - transactional computable
        See Also:
        TransactionalComputable, Transaction.isReadonly()

      • getEnvironmentConfig

        @NotNull
@NotNull EnvironmentConfig getEnvironmentConfig()
        Returns EnvironmentConfig instance used during creation of the environment. If no config was specified and no setting was mutated, then returned config has the same settings as EnvironmentConfig.DEFAULT.
        Returns:
        EnvironmentConfig instance

@NotNull Statistics getStatistics()
        Returns:
        statistics of this Environment instance

        @Nullable
@Nullable StreamCipherProvider getCipherProvider()
        Returns instance of StreamCipherProvider if the environment is configured to be encrypted, or null.
        Returns:
        instance of StreamCipherProvider if the environment is configured to be encrypted, or null
        See Also:
        StreamCipherProvider, EnvironmentConfig.getCipherId()

      • getCipherKey

        @Nullable
@org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable byte[] getCipherKey()
        Returns cipher key to use for database encryption, or null if the environment is not configured to be encrypted.
        Returns:
        cipher key to use for database encryption, or null if the environment is not configured to be encrypted
        See Also:
        StreamCipher.init(byte[], long), EnvironmentConfig.getCipherKey()

      • getCipherBasicIV

        long getCipherBasicIV()
        Returns cipher basic IV (initialization vector) to use for database encryption.
        Returns:
        cipher basic IV (initialization vector) to use for database encryption to be encrypted
        See Also:
        StreamCipher.init(byte[], long), EnvironmentConfig.getCipherBasicIV()

      • executeBeforeGc

        void executeBeforeGc​(java.lang.Runnable action)
        Defines an action to be executed before running database GC cycle in the background cleaner thread.
